Implementation details:

          Precomputation of spf for numbers up to 1000000:

            We can use the sieve method. Steps for spf:

            spf[i] = smallest prime factor of i.

            Initialize spf[i] = i for all i.
            For i from 2 to maxA:
               if spf[i] == i, then i is prime, mark multiples: for j from i*i to maxA step i, if spf[j]==j then set spf[j]=i. Then to factorize a number x:

            while x > 1:
               p = spf[x], count=0
               while spf[x] == p:
                  count++
                  x /= p
               then update maxExp[p] = max(maxExp[p], count)

          #include <stdio.h>
          #include <stdlib.h>
          #include <string.h>
          #define MAX_A 1000000
          #define MOD 1000000007LL

          int spf[MAX_A+1];
          int maxExp[MAX_A+1];   // for primes up to MAX_A

          long long pow_mod(long long base, long long exp, long long mod) {
              base %= mod;
              long long result = 1;
              while (exp > 0) {
                  if (exp & 1) {
                      result = (result * base) % mod;
                  }
                  base = (base * base) % mod;
                  exp >>= 1;
              }
              return result;
          }

          long long mod_inv(long long x, long long mod) {
              return pow_mod(x, mod-2, mod);
          }

          int main() {
              // Precompute spf for [1, MAX_A]
              for (int i = 1; i <= MAX_A; i++) {
                  spf[i] = i;
              }
              for (int i = 2; i <= MAX_A; i++) {
                  if (spf[i] == i) { // i is prime
                      for (long long j = (long long)i*i; j <= MAX_A; j += i) {
                          if (spf[j] == j) {
                              spf[j] = i;
                          }
                      }
                  }
              }

              // Initialize maxExp to 0
              for (int i = 0; i <= MAX_A; i++) {
                  maxExp[i] = 0;
              }

              int N;
              scanf("%d", &N);
              int *A = (int*)malloc(N * sizeof(int));
              for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
                  scanf("%d", &A[i]);
              }

              // Factorize each A[i] and update maxExp
              for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
                  int x = A[i];
                  // Factorize x
                  while (x > 1) {
                      int p = spf[x];
                      int count = 0;
                      while (spf[x] == p) {
                          count++;
                          x /= p;
                      }
                      if (count > maxExp[p]) {
                          maxExp[p] = count;
                      }
                  }
              }

              long long LCM_mod = 1;
              for (int p = 2; p <= MAX_A; p++) {
                  if (maxExp[p] > 0) {
                      LCM_mod = (LCM_mod * pow_mod(p, maxExp[p], MOD)) % MOD;
                  }
              }

              long long ans1 = 0;
              for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
                  long long term = (LCM_mod * mod_inv(A[i], MOD)) % MOD;
                  ans1 = (ans1 + term) % MOD;
              }

              int n = (int)ans1;
              printf("%d \n", n);
              int m = n;
              while (m > 1) {
                  int p;
                  if (m <= MAX_A) {
                      p = spf[m];
                  } else {
                      // Trial division for m > MAX_A
                      p = -1;
                      int limit = (int)(1 + sqrt(m)); // we'll iterate i from 2 to limit
                      for (int i = 2; i <= limit; i++) {
                          if (m % i == 0) {
                              p = i;
                              break;
                          }
                      }
                      if (p == -1) {
                          p = m; // m is prime
                      }
                  }
                  m = m / p;
                  printf("%d \n", m);
              }

              free(A);
              return 0;
          }
